definition: (coll.) back (of a human or other vertebrate)

sentences.english: Always follow the party go, responsibility and play a future backbone of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 永远跟党走，担当未来的责任和民族的脊梁。

sentences.english: Always follow the party go, bear the responsibility and national future backbone.
sentences.chinese: 永远跟党走，担当未来的责任和民族的脊梁。

sentences.english: He slipped end-over-end as the gaps in the road, it is a backbone.
sentences.chinese: 涵管做为道路中的空隙，它是一个脊梁。

sentences.english: The dominating mountains are the spines of the earth and the coordination of the world.
sentences.chinese: 至尊之山，乃地球的脊梁，世间的坐标。

sentences.english: I felt a child go down my spine.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得有一股寒气顺着我的脊梁骨往下窜。

sentences.english: The accident is a salutary reminder of the danger of climbing.
sentences.chinese: 她在一次攀登事故中折断了脊梁骨。

sentences.english: Realistic society and will of the people like burr Ban Za in its back.
sentences.chinese: 现实的社会与人心如芒刺班扎在它得脊梁。

sentences.english: The emptiness here sent shivers down my spine .
sentences.chinese: 这里的空寂让我脊梁骨发凉。

sentences.english: Most of the men's backs were bared and glistening with sweat.
sentences.chinese: 大多数男人们光着脊梁，汗珠晶晶发亮。

sentences.english: She broke her back in a climbing accident .
sentences.chinese: 她在一次攀登事故中折断了脊梁骨。

sentences.english: She broke her back in a climbing accident.
sentences.chinese: 攀登事故中折断了脊梁骨。

sentences.english: After three days in Japan, the spinal column becomes extraordinarily flexible.
sentences.chinese: 在日本呆上三天，脊梁骨变得特别灵活。

sentences.english: He felt the hardness of the iron railing press against his spine .
sentences.chinese: 他感觉到硬邦邦的铁栏杆顶着自己的脊梁。

sentences.english: We got no replacements, no spare parts, so our spine was broken.
sentences.chinese: 没有备用配件，我们脊梁骨就给打断了。

sentences.english: I have been adamant about this because small businesses are the backbone of our economy.
sentences.chinese: 我一直坚持这个法案，因为小企业是我们经济的脊梁。

sentences.english: He felt the hardness of the iron railing press against his spine.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉到硬邦邦的铁栏杆顶着自己的脊梁。

definition: large inscribed stele/fig. great achievement/imperishable masterpiece
lit. able to support both heaven and earth/of indomitable spirit (idiom)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
